intro: Syngonanthus anthemidiflorus var. subglabrescens, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and hairy, often silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features make it a distinctive component of its native ecosystem.
